story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 2
story.storyDescription: Ever since her motherâ€™s death, Noelle hasnâ€™t wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needsâ€¦
story.creator: web-uploader
story.prePaywallNotification: Will the man from the airport bar be able to weaken Noelleâ€™e defenses? Read Episode 2 of THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER.

messages.text: Wh-what?
Noelle can hardly catch her breath because Lawrenceâ€™s green eyes are piercing into her soul.
Miss me already?
Lawrence winks, holding up his phone.
You could have just texted you know.
Passengers around them start groaning for Noelle to take her seat.
Noelleâ€™s heart racesâ€”
Air travel flusters her enough.
And run-ins with this guy Lawrence seem to only make things worse.
A nearby passenger grumbles rudely, telling Noelle to stop flirting and sit down.
Iâ€™m not flirting â€” heâ€™s in my seat!
She points angrily at Lawrence, her heart sinking all the while.
There goes her chance with the first guy sheâ€™s been attracted to in a very long time.
Just when she feels completely deflated, Lawrence looks up innocently.
A smile spreads across his full lips.
She has a sudden urge to press her mouth against hisâ€”
It causes her heart to skitter.
So now youâ€™re accusing me of stealing your seat too?
Noelle rolls her eyes, hoping the action hides her reaction to her flipping stomach.
Ummâ€¦yeah. Iâ€™m 31C.
Are you sure you didnâ€™t read your ticket wrong?
I know how to read a plane ticket!
Instant regret slices through Noelle.
She doesnâ€™t mean to keep snapping at Lawrence.
Thereâ€™s just something about the hectic energy of holiday travel that ties her nerves into a ball.
And thereâ€™s something about this guyâ€¦
That sets all those nerves on fire.
Iâ€™m sorry. I justâ€¦itâ€™s already been a long day.
I almost missed this flight andâ€”
Noelle takes a deep breath and looks down at her e-ticket.
In bold font in the middle of her phone is the seat number.
Oh my godâ€¦Iâ€™m SO sorry. Iâ€™m actually â€” Iâ€™m in 31D.
Lawrence flashes Noelle a devious grin.
And she feels herself melt into a puddle before him.
Do you get off on accusing me of theft or something?
He raises an eyebrow, looking so devilishly handsome.
Got a thing for bad boys?
He enunciates every word, as if he knows he's gotten under her skinâ€¦
And likes driving her wild.
Trying to ignore him, Noelle huffs and launches her duffle bag over her shoulder.
She staggers as she attempts to stuff it into the overhead compartment.
Before Noelle realizes whatâ€™s happening, she feels the weight of her bag lighten.
She looks over her shoulder and sees Lawrence standing behind her.
Heâ€™s flashing her his unnerving grin.
And itâ€™s almost sinful, how delicious it looks on his chiseled face.
Woah! What do you keep in this thing? Bricks?
Books.
Lawrence lets out a deep laugh.
Noelle bristles.
Guess you think reading is for nerds?
No way! I LOVE to read!
But I read like a normal person.
Like, one book per trip.
Thatâ€™s nice.
Noelle sits in her seat and buries her nose in her romance novel, hoping Lawrence will take a hint.
But the blood rushes up her neck as she starts reading.
She forgot she was in the middle of a steamy romance scene.
Noelle feels a puff of breath on the delicate skin of her neck.
She shivers, imagining Lawrence is leaning towards herâ€¦
Inching closer for a kiss.
And then she hears a low whisper.
Soâ€¦how many books did you pack in that bag?
Noelle jumps, shielding the page sheâ€™s reading from view.
None of your business.
Lawrence gestures toward the book in her hand.
Whatâ€™s this one about? You seem hooked.
Lawrence leans closer.
Noelle catches the scent of his cologne.
And it takes every last shred of her willpower not to close her eyes and justâ€¦
Breathe.
Hey wait a minuteâ€”
Lawrence reaches forward to grab the book out of Noelleâ€™s hands.
Thatâ€™s a dirty book!
Shh! It is NOT a dirty book.
Noelle takes a deep breath to compose herself, and then turns around to face Lawrence.
Her breath catches when she looks him in the eyesâ€”
Heâ€™s so hot, she can barely function.
Please give me my book.
Lawrence must see the sad defeat in Noelleâ€™s eyes.
Because his voice is no longer teasing when he responds.
Iâ€™m sorry. Here.
He hands her the book and then laces his fingers innocently together on his lap.
As the plane takes off, Noelle feels her heart open.
She loves flying â€” loves the isolation and energyâ€¦
Loves being completely unreachable and undistracted as she sinks into a good book.
But as she gets back to reading, her eyes start to wanderâ€¦
To the bobbing foot in the row beside her.
She shuts her book.
If you must know, I brought seven books.
Seven?
Yes. Christmas is the best time of the year for some people, but for meâ€¦
Letâ€™s just say I need my alone time at Christmas.
Lawrence recoils backwards as if Noelleâ€™s words have slapped him.
Iâ€™ll leave you alone. Iâ€™m sorry.
You can go back to your book.
Lawrence puts on his headphones and stares straight aheadâ€¦
Not saying another word to Noelle for the rest of the flight.
And now, Noelle isnâ€™t sure she wants to go back to her book anymoreâ€¦
But with Lawrence ignoring her, she has no choice but to dive back into the pages before herâ€¦
Filled with imaginary boyfriends and fantasy romancesâ€¦
As she feels another chance at real-life romance slip away.
